alert.note: Alert for Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:55PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Seneca and southwestern Cayuga Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Romulus, or 11 miles south of Seneca Falls, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Genoa, Ledyard, Aurora, Levanna, Venice Center, King Ferry, Casowasco, Scipio Center, Long Point State Park and Deans Cove Boat Launch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
